intro: Sideroxylon campestre, commonly known as the African ironwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a rough texture. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
